questions.question_text:
An administrator installs vRealize Automation and adds a new vCenter Server endpoint.
Data collection from the vCenter Server is failing resulting in the following error:
//IMG//

What is a possible cause of this issue?

choices.B: Transport Layer Security (TLS) is disabled on IaaS Windows server machines.
choices.C: Distributed Transaction Coordinator (DTC) remote transactions are disabled on IaaS Windows Server machines.
choices.A: Incorrect vCenter Server credentials are being used in the endpoint configuration.
choices.D: The vRealize Automation's Proxy Agent for vSphere service is not running.

questions.question_text: Which two components require a load balancer? (Choose two.)
Which on-demand network component is only available when using NSX Data Center for vSphere on the blueprint design canvas?

discussion.content:
A is right.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.6/com.vmware.vra.prepare.use.doc/GUID-B6E703B8-6F46-4BE0-998D-9B6B7E402129.html#GUID-B6E703B8-6F46-4BE0-998D-9B6B7E402129
Available Network Types
The following network types are available as you define a network profile:
 Existing network
 On-demand routed network
 On-demand NAT network
 On-demand private network (NSX for vSphere only)
Correct answer is A , This private network option is only available for NSX for vSphere. It is not available for NSX-T

I'm not sure. I think I should C
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.3/com.vmware.vra.prepare.use.doc/GUID-648D67DE-030A-4EE8-9E99-4AD1875A668D.html

comments.content:
Must be C. 
First the machine gets registered and cloned in vSphere, maybe it will be customized, then the machine will be activated (powered on), and after the deployment is complete, the customization of the OS starts.

questions.question_text:
A vRealize Automation administrator wants to run a vRealize Orchestrator workflow immediately after a virtual machine has been given an IP address by using a vSphere customization specification configured in a blueprint.
Which event subscription machine provisioning state should the administrator use to achieve this?

choices.D: Assign a new machine prefix to the vSphere endpoint.
choices.B: Select the required machine prefix in the business group settings.
choices.A: Assign a new machine prefix to the reservation.
choices.C: Select the required machine prefix in the fabric group.

questions.question_text:
A vRealize Automation user provisions virtual machines (VMs) but complains that the machine prefix for his VMs does not match that of his business group. The vRealize Automation administrator confirms that the blueprint component has the machine prefix set to "Use Group Default."
Which step should be the administrator take to fix the issue with the incorrect machine prefix?
